020package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.blocks;
021
022import java.util.Arrays;
023import java.util.Locale;
024
025import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.DetailAstImpl;
026import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.StatelessCheck;
027import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractCheck;
028import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.DetailAST;
029import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.TokenTypes;
030import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.CheckUtil;
031import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.CommonUtil;
032import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.TokenUtil;
033
034/**
035 * <p>
036 * Checks the placement of right curly braces ({@code '}'}) for code blocks. This check supports
037 * if-else, try-catch-finally blocks, while-loops, for-loops,
038 * method definitions, class definitions, constructor definitions,
039 * instance, static initialization blocks, annotation definitions and enum definitions.
040 * For right curly brace of expression blocks of arrays, lambdas and class instances
041 * please follow issue
042 * <a href="https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/5945">#5945</a>.
043 * For right curly brace of enum constant please follow issue
044 * <a href="https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/7519">#7519</a>.
045 * </p>
046 * <ul>
047 * <li>
048 * Property {@code option} - Specify the policy on placement of a right curly brace
049 * (<code>'}'</code>).
050 * Default value is {@code same}.
051 * </li>
052 * <li>
053 * Property {@code tokens} - tokens to check
054 * Default value is:
055 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_TRY">
056 * LITERAL_TRY</a>,
057 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_CATCH">
058 * LITERAL_CATCH</a>,
059 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_FINALLY">
060 * LITERAL_FINALLY</a>,
061 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_IF">
062 * LITERAL_IF</a>,
063 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_ELSE">
064 * LITERAL_ELSE</a>.
065 * </li>
066 * </ul>
067 * <p>
068 * To configure the check:
069 * </p>
070 * <pre>
071 * &lt;module name="RightCurly"/&gt;
072 * </pre>
073 * <p>
074 * Example:
075 * </p>
076 * <pre>
077 * public class Test {
078 *
079 *   public void test() {
080 *
081 *     if (foo) {
082 *       bar();
083 *     }           // violation, right curly must be in the same line as the 'else' keyword
084 *     else {
085 *       bar();
086 *     }
087 *
088 *     if (foo) {
089 *       bar();
090 *     } else {     // OK
091 *       bar();
092 *     }
093 *
094 *     if (foo) { bar(); } int i = 0; // violation
095 *                   // ^^^ statement is not allowed on same line after curly right brace
096 *
097 *     if (foo) { bar(); }            // OK
098 *     int i = 0;
099 *
100 *     try {
101 *       bar();
102 *     }           // violation, rightCurly must be in the same line as 'catch' keyword
103 *     catch (Exception e) {
104 *       bar();
105 *     }
106 *
107 *     try {
108 *       bar();
109 *     } catch (Exception e) { // OK
110 *       bar();
111 *     }
112 *
113 *   }                         // OK
114 *
115 *   public void testSingleLine() { bar(); } // OK, because singleline is allowed
116 * }
117 * </pre>
118 * <p>
119 * To configure the check with policy {@code alone} for {@code else} and
120 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#METHOD_DEF">
121 * METHOD_DEF</a> tokens:
122 * </p>
123 * <pre>
124 * &lt;module name=&quot;RightCurly&quot;&gt;
125 *   &lt;property name=&quot;option&quot; value=&quot;alone&quot;/&gt;
126 *   &lt;property name=&quot;tokens&quot; value=&quot;LITERAL_ELSE, METHOD_DEF&quot;/&gt;
127 * &lt;/module&gt;
128 * </pre>
129 * <p>
130 * Example:
131 * </p>
132 * <pre>
133 * public class Test {
134 *
135 *   public void test() {
136 *
137 *     if (foo) {
138 *       bar();
139 *     } else { bar(); }   // violation, right curly must be alone on line
140 *
141 *     if (foo) {
142 *       bar();
143 *     } else {
144 *       bar();
145 *     }                   // OK
146 *
147 *     try {
148 *       bar();
149 *     } catch (Exception e) { // OK because config is set to token METHOD_DEF and LITERAL_ELSE
150 *       bar();
151 *     }
152 *
153 *   }                         // OK
154 *
155 *   public void violate() { bar; } // violation, singleline is not allowed here
156 *
157 *   public void ok() {
158 *     bar();
159 *   }                              // OK
160 * }
161 * </pre>
162 * <p>
163 * To configure the check with policy {@code alone_or_singleline} for {@code if}
164 * and <a href="apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#METHOD_DEF">
165 * METHOD_DEF</a>
166 * tokens:
167 * </p>
168 * <pre>
169 * &lt;module name=&quot;RightCurly&quot;&gt;
170 *  &lt;property name=&quot;option&quot; value=&quot;alone_or_singleline&quot;/&gt;
171 *  &lt;property name=&quot;tokens&quot; value=&quot;LITERAL_IF, METHOD_DEF&quot;/&gt;
172 * &lt;/module&gt;
173 * </pre>
174 * <p>
175 * Example:
176 * </p>
177 * <pre>
178 * public class Test {
179 *
180 *   public void test() {
181 *
182 *     if (foo) {
183 *       bar();
184 *     } else {        // violation, right curly must be alone on line
185 *       bar();
186 *     }
187 *
188 *     if (foo) {
189 *       bar();
190 *     }               // OK
191 *     else {
192 *       bar();
193 *     }
194 *
195 *     try {
196 *       bar();
197 *     } catch (Exception e) {        // OK because config did not set token LITERAL_TRY
198 *       bar();
199 *     }
200 *
201 *   }                                // OK
202 *
203 *   public void violate() { bar(); } // OK , because singleline
204 * }
205 * </pre>
206 *
207 * @since 3.0
208 */
209@StatelessCheck
210public class RightCurlyCheck extends AbstractCheck {
211
212    /**
213     * A key is pointing to the warning message text in "messages.properties"
214     * file.
215     */
216    public static final String MSG_KEY_LINE_BREAK_BEFORE = "line.break.before";
217
218    /**
219     * A key is pointing to the warning message text in "messages.properties"
220     * file.
221     */
222    public static final String MSG_KEY_LINE_ALONE = "line.alone";
223
224    /**
225     * A key is pointing to the warning message text in "messages.properties"
226     * file.
227     */
228    public static final String MSG_KEY_LINE_SAME = "line.same";
229
230    /**
231     * Specify the policy on placement of a right curly brace (<code>'}'</code>).
232     */
233    private RightCurlyOption option = RightCurlyOption.SAME;
234
235    /**
236     * Setter to specify the policy on placement of a right curly brace (<code>'}'</code>).
237     * @param optionStr string to decode option from
238     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if unable to decode
239     */
240    public void setOption(String optionStr) {
241        option = RightCurlyOption.valueOf(optionStr.trim().toUpperCase(Locale.ENGLISH));
242    }
243
244    @Override
245    public int[] getDefaultTokens() {
246        return new int[] {
247            TokenTypes.LITERAL_TRY,
248            TokenTypes.LITERAL_CATCH,
249            TokenTypes.LITERAL_FINALLY,
250            TokenTypes.LITERAL_IF,
251            TokenTypes.LITERAL_ELSE,
252        };
253    }
254
255    @Override
256    public int[] getAcceptableTokens() {
257        return new int[] {
258            TokenTypes.LITERAL_TRY,
259            TokenTypes.LITERAL_CATCH,
260            TokenTypes.LITERAL_FINALLY,
261            TokenTypes.LITERAL_IF,
262            TokenTypes.LITERAL_ELSE,
263            TokenTypes.CLASS_DEF,
264            TokenTypes.METHOD_DEF,
265            TokenTypes.CTOR_DEF,
266            TokenTypes.LITERAL_FOR,
267            TokenTypes.LITERAL_WHILE,
268            TokenTypes.LITERAL_DO,
269            TokenTypes.STATIC_INIT,
270            TokenTypes.INSTANCE_INIT,
271            TokenTypes.ANNOTATION_DEF,
272            TokenTypes.ENUM_DEF,
273        };
274    }
275
276    @Override
277    public int[] getRequiredTokens() {
278        return CommonUtil.EMPTY_INT_ARRAY;
279    }
280
281    @Override
282    public void visitToken(DetailAST ast) {
283        final Details details = Details.getDetails(ast);
284        final DetailAST rcurly = details.rcurly;
285
286        if (rcurly != null) {
287            final String violation = validate(details);
288            if (!violation.isEmpty()) {
289                log(rcurly, violation, "}", rcurly.getColumnNo() + 1);
290            }
291        }
292    }
293
294    /**
295     * Does general validation.
296     * @param details for validation.
297     * @return violation message or empty string
298     *     if there was not violation during validation.
299     */
300    private String validate(Details details) {
301        String violation = "";
302        if (shouldHaveLineBreakBefore(option, details)) {
303            violation = MSG_KEY_LINE_BREAK_BEFORE;
304        }
305        else if (shouldBeOnSameLine(option, details)) {
306            violation = MSG_KEY_LINE_SAME;
307        }
308        else if (shouldBeAloneOnLine(option, details, getLine(details.rcurly.getLineNo() - 1))) {
309            violation = MSG_KEY_LINE_ALONE;
310        }
311        return violation;
312    }
313
314    /**
315     * Checks whether a right curly should have a line break before.
316     * @param bracePolicy option for placing the right curly brace.
317     * @param details details for validation.
318     * @return true if a right curly should have a line break before.
319     */
320    private static boolean shouldHaveLineBreakBefore(RightCurlyOption bracePolicy,
321                                                     Details details) {
322        return bracePolicy == RightCurlyOption.SAME
323                && !hasLineBreakBefore(details.rcurly)
324                && !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(details.lcurly, details.rcurly);
325    }
326
327    /**
328     * Checks that a right curly should be on the same line as the next statement.
329     * @param bracePolicy option for placing the right curly brace
330     * @param details Details for validation
331     * @return true if a right curly should be alone on a line.
332     */
333    private static boolean shouldBeOnSameLine(RightCurlyOption bracePolicy, Details details) {
334        return bracePolicy == RightCurlyOption.SAME
335                && !details.shouldCheckLastRcurly
336                && !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(details.rcurly, details.nextToken);
337    }
338
339    /**
340     * Checks that a right curly should be alone on a line.
341     * @param bracePolicy option for placing the right curly brace
342     * @param details Details for validation
343     * @param targetSrcLine A string with contents of rcurly's line
344     * @return true if a right curly should be alone on a line.
345     */
346    private static boolean shouldBeAloneOnLine(RightCurlyOption bracePolicy,
347                                               Details details,
348                                               String targetSrcLine) {
349        return bracePolicy == RightCurlyOption.ALONE
350                    && shouldBeAloneOnLineWithAloneOption(details, targetSrcLine)
351                || (bracePolicy == RightCurlyOption.ALONE_OR_SINGLELINE
352                    || details.shouldCheckLastRcurly)
353                    && shouldBeAloneOnLineWithNotAloneOption(details, targetSrcLine);
354    }
355
356    /**
357     * Whether right curly should be alone on line when ALONE option is used.
358     * @param details details for validation.
359     * @param targetSrcLine A string with contents of rcurly's line
360     * @return true, if right curly should be alone on line when ALONE option is used.
361     */
362    private static boolean shouldBeAloneOnLineWithAloneOption(Details details,
363                                                              String targetSrcLine) {
364        return !isAloneOnLine(details, targetSrcLine);
365    }
366
367    /**
368     * Whether right curly should be alone on line when ALONE_OR_SINGLELINE or SAME option is used.
369     * @param details details for validation.
370     * @param targetSrcLine A string with contents of rcurly's line
371     * @return true, if right curly should be alone on line
372     *         when ALONE_OR_SINGLELINE or SAME option is used.
373     */
374    private static boolean shouldBeAloneOnLineWithNotAloneOption(Details details,
375                                                                 String targetSrcLine) {
376        return shouldBeAloneOnLineWithAloneOption(details, targetSrcLine)
377                && !isBlockAloneOnSingleLine(details);
378    }
379
380    /**
381     * Checks whether right curly is alone on a line.
382     * @param details for validation.
383     * @param targetSrcLine A string with contents of rcurly's line
384     * @return true if right curly is alone on a line.
385     */
386    private static boolean isAloneOnLine(Details details, String targetSrcLine) {
387        final DetailAST rcurly = details.rcurly;
388        final DetailAST nextToken = details.nextToken;
389        return (!TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(rcurly, nextToken) || skipDoubleBraceInstInit(details))
390                && CommonUtil.hasWhitespaceBefore(details.rcurly.getColumnNo(), targetSrcLine);
391    }
392
393    /**
394     * This method determines if the double brace initialization should be skipped over by the
395     * check. Double brace initializations are treated differently. The corresponding inner
396     * rcurly is treated as if it was alone on line even when it may be followed by another
397     * rcurly and a semi, raising no violations.
398     * <i>Please do note though that the line should not contain anything other than the following
399     * right curly and the semi following it or else violations will be raised.</i>
400     * Only the kind of double brace initializations shown in the following example code will be
401     * skipped over:<br>
402     * <pre>
403     *     {@code Map<String, String> map = new LinkedHashMap<>() {{
404     *           put("alpha", "man");
405     *       }}; // no violation}
406     * </pre>
407     *
408     * @param details {@link Details} object containing the details relevant to the rcurly
409     * @return if the double brace initialization rcurly should be skipped over by the check
410     */
411    private static boolean skipDoubleBraceInstInit(Details details) {
412        final DetailAST rcurly = details.rcurly;
413        final DetailAST tokenAfterNextToken = Details.getNextToken(details.nextToken);
414        return rcurly.getParent().getParent().getType() == TokenTypes.INSTANCE_INIT
415                && details.nextToken.getType() == TokenTypes.RCURLY
416                && rcurly.getLineNo() != Details.getNextToken(tokenAfterNextToken).getLineNo();
417    }
418
419    /**
420     * Checks whether block has a single-line format and is alone on a line.
421     * @param details for validation.
422     * @return true if block has single-line format and is alone on a line.
423     */
424    private static boolean isBlockAloneOnSingleLine(Details details) {
425        final DetailAST rcurly = details.rcurly;
426        final DetailAST lcurly = details.lcurly;
427        DetailAST nextToken = details.nextToken;
428        while (nextToken.getType() == TokenTypes.LITERAL_ELSE) {
429            nextToken = Details.getNextToken(nextToken);
430        }
431        if (nextToken.getType() == TokenTypes.DO_WHILE) {
432            final DetailAST doWhileSemi = nextToken.getParent().getLastChild();
433            nextToken = Details.getNextToken(doWhileSemi);
434        }
435        return TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(rcurly, lcurly)
436                && (!TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(rcurly, nextToken)
437                || isRightcurlyFollowedBySemicolon(details));
438    }
439
440    /**
441     * Checks whether the right curly is followed by a semicolon.
442     * @param details details for validation.
443     * @return true if the right curly is followed by a semicolon.
444     */
445    private static boolean isRightcurlyFollowedBySemicolon(Details details) {
446        return details.nextToken.getType() == TokenTypes.SEMI;
447    }
448
449    /**
450     * Checks if right curly has line break before.
451     * @param rightCurly right curly token.
452     * @return true, if right curly has line break before.
453     */
454    private static boolean hasLineBreakBefore(DetailAST rightCurly) {
455        DetailAST previousToken = rightCurly.getPreviousSibling();
456        if (previousToken == null) {
457            previousToken = rightCurly.getParent();
458        }
459        return !TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(rightCurly, previousToken);
460    }
461
462    /**
463     * Structure that contains all details for validation.
464     */
465    private static final class Details {
466
467        /**
468         * Token types that identify tokens that will never have SLIST in their AST.
469         */
470        private static final int[] TOKENS_WITH_NO_CHILD_SLIST = {
471            TokenTypes.CLASS_DEF,
472            TokenTypes.ENUM_DEF,
473            TokenTypes.ANNOTATION_DEF,
474        };
475
476        /** Right curly. */
477        private final DetailAST rcurly;
478        /** Left curly. */
479        private final DetailAST lcurly;
480        /** Next token. */
481        private final DetailAST nextToken;
482        /** Should check last right curly. */
483        private final boolean shouldCheckLastRcurly;
484
485        /**
486         * Constructor.
487         * @param lcurly the lcurly of the token whose details are being collected
488         * @param rcurly the rcurly of the token whose details are being collected
489         * @param nextToken the token after the token whose details are being collected
490         * @param shouldCheckLastRcurly boolean value to determine if to check last rcurly
491         */
492        private Details(DetailAST lcurly, DetailAST rcurly,
493                        DetailAST nextToken, boolean shouldCheckLastRcurly) {
494            this.lcurly = lcurly;
495            this.rcurly = rcurly;
496            this.nextToken = nextToken;
497            this.shouldCheckLastRcurly = shouldCheckLastRcurly;
498        }
499
500        /**
501         * Collects validation Details.
502         * @param ast a {@code DetailAST} value
503         * @return object containing all details to make a validation
504         */
505        private static Details getDetails(DetailAST ast) {
506            final Details details;
507            switch (ast.getType()) {
508                case TokenTypes.LITERAL_TRY:
509                case TokenTypes.LITERAL_CATCH:
510                case TokenTypes.LITERAL_FINALLY:
511                    details = getDetailsForTryCatchFinally(ast);
512                    break;
513                case TokenTypes.LITERAL_IF:
514                case TokenTypes.LITERAL_ELSE:
515                    details = getDetailsForIfElse(ast);
516                    break;
517                case TokenTypes.LITERAL_DO:
518                case TokenTypes.LITERAL_WHILE:
519                case TokenTypes.LITERAL_FOR:
520                    details = getDetailsForLoops(ast);
521                    break;
522                default:
523                    details = getDetailsForOthers(ast);
524                    break;
525            }
526            return details;
527        }
528
529        /**
530         * Collects validation details for LITERAL_TRY, LITERAL_CATCH, and LITERAL_FINALLY.
531         * @param ast a {@code DetailAST} value
532         * @return object containing all details to make a validation
533         */
534        private static Details getDetailsForTryCatchFinally(DetailAST ast) {
535            final DetailAST lcurly;
536            DetailAST nextToken;
537            final int tokenType = ast.getType();
538            if (tokenType == TokenTypes.LITERAL_TRY) {
539                if (ast.getFirstChild().getType() == TokenTypes.RESOURCE_SPECIFICATION) {
540                    lcurly = ast.getFirstChild().getNextSibling();
541                }
542                else {
543                    lcurly = ast.getFirstChild();
544                }
545                nextToken = lcurly.getNextSibling();
546            }
547            else {
548                nextToken = ast.getNextSibling();
549                lcurly = ast.getLastChild();
550            }
551
552            final boolean shouldCheckLastRcurly;
553            if (nextToken == null) {
554                shouldCheckLastRcurly = true;
555                nextToken = getNextToken(ast);
556            }
557            else {
558                shouldCheckLastRcurly = false;
559            }
560
561            final DetailAST rcurly = lcurly.getLastChild();
562            return new Details(lcurly, rcurly, nextToken, shouldCheckLastRcurly);
563        }
564
565        /**
566         * Collects validation details for LITERAL_IF and LITERAL_ELSE.
567         * @param ast a {@code DetailAST} value
568         * @return object containing all details to make a validation
569         */
570        private static Details getDetailsForIfElse(DetailAST ast) {
571            final boolean shouldCheckLastRcurly;
572            final DetailAST lcurly;
573            DetailAST nextToken = ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.LITERAL_ELSE);
574
575            if (nextToken == null) {
576                shouldCheckLastRcurly = true;
577                nextToken = getNextToken(ast);
578                lcurly = ast.getLastChild();
579            }
580            else {
581                shouldCheckLastRcurly = false;
582                lcurly = nextToken.getPreviousSibling();
583            }
584
585            DetailAST rcurly = null;
586            if (lcurly.getType() == TokenTypes.SLIST) {
587                rcurly = lcurly.getLastChild();
588            }
589            return new Details(lcurly, rcurly, nextToken, shouldCheckLastRcurly);
590        }
591
592        /**
593         * Collects validation details for CLASS_DEF, METHOD DEF, CTOR_DEF, STATIC_INIT,
594         * INSTANCE_INIT, ANNOTATION_DEF and ENUM_DEF.
595         * @param ast a {@code DetailAST} value
596         * @return an object containing all details to make a validation
597         */
598        private static Details getDetailsForOthers(DetailAST ast) {
599            DetailAST rcurly = null;
600            final DetailAST lcurly;
601            final int tokenType = ast.getType();
602            if (isTokenWithNoChildSlist(tokenType)) {
603                final DetailAST child = ast.getLastChild();
604                lcurly = child.getFirstChild();
605                rcurly = child.getLastChild();
606            }
607            else {
608                lcurly = ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.SLIST);
609                if (lcurly != null) {
610                    // SLIST could be absent if method is abstract
611                    rcurly = lcurly.getLastChild();
612                }
613            }
614            return new Details(lcurly, rcurly, getNextToken(ast), true);
615        }
616
617        /**
618         * Tests whether the provided tokenType will never have a SLIST as child in its AST.
619         * Like CLASS_DEF, ANNOTATION_DEF etc.
620         * @param tokenType the tokenType to test against.
621         * @return weather provided tokenType is definition token.
622         */
623        private static boolean isTokenWithNoChildSlist(int tokenType) {
624            return Arrays.stream(TOKENS_WITH_NO_CHILD_SLIST).anyMatch(token -> token == tokenType);
625        }
626
627        /**
628         * Collects validation details for loops' tokens.
629         * @param ast a {@code DetailAST} value
630         * @return an object containing all details to make a validation
631         */
632        private static Details getDetailsForLoops(DetailAST ast) {
633            DetailAST rcurly = null;
634            final DetailAST lcurly;
635            final DetailAST nextToken;
636            final int tokenType = ast.getType();
637            final boolean shouldCheckLastRcurly;
638            if (tokenType == TokenTypes.LITERAL_DO) {
639                shouldCheckLastRcurly = false;
640                nextToken = ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.DO_WHILE);
641                lcurly = ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.SLIST);
642                if (lcurly != null) {
643                    rcurly = lcurly.getLastChild();
644                }
645            }
646            else {
647                shouldCheckLastRcurly = true;
648                lcurly = ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.SLIST);
649                if (lcurly != null) {
650                    // SLIST could be absent in code like "while(true);"
651                    rcurly = lcurly.getLastChild();
652                }
653                nextToken = getNextToken(ast);
654            }
655            return new Details(lcurly, rcurly, nextToken, shouldCheckLastRcurly);
656        }
657
658        /**
659         * Finds next token after the given one.
660         * @param ast the given node.
661         * @return the token which represents next lexical item.
662         */
663        private static DetailAST getNextToken(DetailAST ast) {
664            DetailAST next = null;
665            DetailAST parent = ast;
666            while (next == null && parent != null) {
667                next = parent.getNextSibling();
668                parent = parent.getParent();
669            }
670            if (next == null) {
671                // a DetailAST object with DetailAST#NOT_INITIALIZED for line and column numbers
672                // that no 'actual' DetailAST objects can have.
673                next = new DetailAstImpl();
674            }
675            else {
676                next = CheckUtil.getFirstNode(next);
677            }
678            return next;
679        }
680
681    }
682
683}
